    Spacetime Data in statsurv An introduction to `statsurv`

Augment data with information from an arima_tidy object

Source: R/arima_tidy.R
augment.arima_tidy.Rd

A method for the augment generic for arima_tidy objects. Takes a model object and a dataset, and adds information about fitted values in the .fitted column and model residuals in the .resid column.

Usage

# S3 method for arima_tidy
augment(x, newdata, ...)

Arguments

x

The result of an arima_tidy fit.

newdata

The data used to originally fit the model as well as any additional data to be used to generate predictions. The rows are assumed to be ordered from earliest to latest. If the originally model was fit on n data points, the first n rows of newdata are assumed to be the data used to fit the model, and any additional rows are used to generate predictions using predict.arima_tidy.

...

Additional arguments. Not used.

Value

newdata with additional columns .fitted and .resid containing the predicted values and the residuals.

Examples

data(presidents_df)
# Fit on the first 110 rows, predict the last 10
fit <- arima_tidy(approval_rating ~ 1,
                  data = presidents_df[1:110, ],
                  order = c(1, 0, 0))
# Augment takes the whole dataset (both training and prediction data)
augment(fit, presidents_df)
#>     approval_rating    date election_year  .fitted       .resid
#> 1                NA 1945.25             0       NA           NA
#> 2                87 1945.50             0 69.51369  17.48630754

fit <- arima_tidy(approval_rating ~ election_year,
                  data = presidents_df[1:110, ],
                  order = c(1, 0, 0))
augment(fit, presidents_df)
